title: Bond Tension Component
description: Models the classical physics of a relationship Bond, including its strength, tension, and resonance properties. This is managed by the Particular engine.

physics_properties.title: Base Physics Properties
physics_properties.description: Defines the common physics-related properties for components and laws.

collapse_sensitive.description: Indicates if the object is affected by or triggers quantum collapse.

engine.description: The physics engine responsible for this object.

is_quantum.description: Indicates if the object has quantum properties.

bond_strength.title: Normalized Value
bond_strength.description: A reusable definition for a floating-point number normalized between 0.0 and 1.0.

torsional_stress.description: The cognitive dissonance or strain on the bond. Can be positive (creative tension) or negative (draining conflict).

spring_constant.description: The 'stiffness' of the bond, representing its resistance to change.

damping_coefficient.description: The 'inertia' of the bond, representing how quickly it returns to equilibrium after a perturbation.

resonance_phase.description: The phase angle for resonance calculations with other bonds.
